xmsg.xsys.regdis package¶

Submodules¶

xmsg.xsys.regdis.xMsgRegDatabase module¶

class xmsg.xsys.regdis.xMsgRegDatabase.xMsgRegDatabase[source]¶

A registration database of xMsg actors.

Actors are grouped by topic, i.e., actors registered with the same topic will be in the same group.

db¶

dict – dict() that stores the registration information for the xMsg actors.

all()[source]¶

returns all topics

Returns:list of all topics in the database
Return type:list
clear()[source]¶

clears the database, it will erase all data stored

find(domain, subject='*', xtype='*')[source]¶

Finds the registration information based on the topic composition

The method will find registration from the following way

  • domain:*:* -> all registration for specific domain
  • domain:somesubject:* -> all registration for specific domain and subject
  • domain:somesubject:sometype -> all registration for specific topic
Parameters:
  • domain (string) – registration domain
  • subject (string) – registration subject
  • xtype (string) – registration type
Returns:

set of serialized registration data
Return type:

Set
get(topic)[source]¶

returns all data for specific topic :param topic: topic of the register to retrieve

Returns:serialized register data (serialized xMsgRegistration)
Return type:bytes[]
register(registration_data)[source]¶

Register the xMsg actor registration information

Parameters:registration_data (xMsgRegistration) – actor registration information
remove(registration_data)[source]¶

Removes specific registration from the database

Parameters:registration_data (xMsgRegistration) – actor registration information
remove_by_host(host)[source]¶

Removes all stored registrations for specific hostname

Method that removes all values of the registration database that have a specified host set, i.e. removes registration information of all xMsg actors that are running on a specified host.

Parameters:host (String) – host name of the xMsg

xmsg.xsys.regdis.xMsgRegDriver module¶

class xmsg.xsys.regdis.xMsgRegDriver.xMsgRegDriver(context, fe_host='localhost')[source]¶

Methods for registration and discovery of xMsg actors, i.e. publishers and subscribers.

This class also contains the base method used by all xMsg extending classes to create 0MQ socket for communications. This means that this class owns the 0MQ context. The sockets use the default registrar port: xMsgConstants#REGISTRAR_PORT.

context¶

zmq.Context – zmq context

fe_host¶

String – xmsg frontend hostname

find_global(name, data, is_publisher)[source]¶

Searches the FE registration and discovery databases for an actor

The method will search for xMsg actors that publishes or subscribes the topic of the interest (globally). The search criteria i.e. topic is defined within the xMsgRegistrationData object.

Parameters:
  • name (String) – the name of the requester/sender
  • registration_data (xMsgRegistration) – xMsgRegistration object
  • is_publisher (bool) – if set to be true then this is a request to register a publisher, otherwise this is a subscriber registration request
Returns:

list of xMsgRegistration objects
Return type:

list
find_local(name, registration_data, is_publisher)[source]¶

Searches the local registration and discovery databases for an actor

The method will search for xMsg actors that publishes or subscribes the topic of the interest (locally). The search criteria i.e. topic is defined within the xMsgRegistration object.

Parameters:
  • name (String) – the name of the requester/sender
  • registration_data (xMsgRegistration) – xMsgRegistration object
  • is_publisher – if set to be true then this is a request to register a publisher, otherwise this is a subscriber registration request
Returns:

list of xMsgRegistrationData objects
Return type:

list

Registers xMsg actor in front-end registration and discovery server

Parameters:

  • registration_data (xMsgRegistration) – xMsgRegistration object
  • is_publisher (bool) – if set to be true then this is a request to register a publisher, otherwise this is a subscriber registration request
register_local(name, data, is_publisher)[source]¶

Registers xMsg actor with the local registration and discovery server

Parameters:
  • name (String) – the name of the requester/sender
  • registration_data (xMsgRegistration) – xMsgRegistration object
  • is_publisher (bool) – if set to be true then this is a request to register a publisher, otherwise this is a subscriber registration request
remove_all_registration_fe(host, name)[source]¶

Removes all xMsg actors registration from the front-end registration

Removes all xMsg actors (publishers and subscribers) registration from the front-end global registration and discovery database that were previously registered on a specified host local database. This method is usually called by the xMsgRegistrar when it shuts down or gets interrupted.

Parameters:
  • host (String) – host name of the xMsgNode
  • name (String) – the name of the sender
remove_registration_fe(name, data, is_publisher)[source]¶

Removes xMsg actor from the front-end registration and discovery server

Parameters:
  • name (String) – the name of the requester/sender
  • registration_data (xMsgRegistration) – xMsgRegistration object
  • is_publisher (bool) – if set to be true then this is a request to register a publisher, otherwise this is a subscriber registration request
remove_registration_local(name, data, is_publisher)[source]¶

Removes xMsg actor from the local registration and discovery server

Parameters:
  • name (String) – the name of the requester/sender
  • registration_data (xMsgRegistration) – xMsgRegistration object
  • is_publisher (bool) – if set to be true then this is a request to register a publisher, otherwise this is a subscriber registration request
zmq_socket(context, socket_type, hostname, port, boc)[source]¶

Creates and returns zmq socket object

Parameters:
  • context (zmq.Context) – zmq context
  • socket_type (int) – the type of the socket (integer defined by zmq)
  • hostname (String) – host name
  • port (int) – port number
  • boc (String) – ‘bind’ or ‘connect’ host and port to socket Note that for xMsg proxies we always connect (boc = ‘connect’) (proxies are XPUB/XSUB sockets).
Returns:

zmq socket object
Return type:

zmq.Socket

xmsg.xsys.regdis.xMsgRegResponse module¶

class xmsg.xsys.regdis.xMsgRegResponse.xMsgRegResponse(topic, sender, data, status='success')[source]¶

A wrapper for a response to a registration or discovery request.

A response of the xMsgRegService registration service can be an string indicating that the request was successful, a set of registration data in case a discovery request was received, or an error description indicating that something wrong happened with the request.

topic¶

String – topic of the response message

sender¶

String – response sender

status¶

String – status of the request to respond

data¶

bytes[] – registration data

classmethod create_from_multipart_request(request)[source]¶

Returns (creates) a response object from multipart request

Parameters:request (bytes[]) – 0MQ multipart request
Returns:response object
Return type:xMsgRegResponse

Returns response data array

Returns:data array from response
Return type:bytes[]
get_sender()[source]¶

Returns the sender in the response

Returns:response sender
Return type:String
get_serialized_msg()[source]¶

Returns the response instance serialized

Returns:serialized message for 0MQ
Return type:bytes[]
get_status()[source]¶

Returns request response status

It can be xMsgConstants#SUCCESS or an error string indicating a problem with the request.

Returns:status obtained from registration service
Return type:String
get_topic()[source]¶

Returns topic in the response

Returns:response topic
Return type:String

Sets the sender in the response

Parameters:sender (string) – name of sender
set_status(status)[source]¶

Sets the status in the response

Parameters:status (string) – status by default is success otherwise an string indicating the error in the request

Sets the topic in the response

Parameters:topic (xMsgTopic) – topic for the response

xmsg.xsys.regdis.xMsgRegService module¶

class xmsg.xsys.regdis.xMsgRegService.xMsgRegService(context, fe_host)[source]¶

Bases: threading.Thread

The main registration service, that always runs in a separate thread. Contains two separate databases to store publishers and subscribers registration data. The key for the data base is xMsg topic, constructed as:

domain:subject:type

Creates REP socket server on a default port Following request will be serviced:

  • Register publisher
  • Register subscriber
  • Find publisher
  • Find subscriber
  • Remove publisher
  • Remove subscriber
  • Remove All registration
context¶

zmq.Context – zmq context

host¶

String – registration service host

port¶

int – registrar service port. By default is 8888

subscribers_db¶

xMsgRegDatabase – subscribers database

publishers_db¶

xMsgRegDatabase – publishers database

process_request(registration_request)[source]¶

Method to process the registration request and interact with the Registration DB

The process_request method will receive a request from a xMsg actor to register or for obtaining registration info from the database. The method is able to respond to the following requests (this request is taken from the topic of the request message):

  • REMOVE_ALL_REGISTRATION
  • REGISTER_PUBLISHER
  • REGISTER_SUBSCRIBER
  • REMOVE_PUBLISHER
  • REMOVE_SUBSCRIBER
  • FIND_PUBLISHER
  • FIND_SUBSCRIBER
  • REMOVE_ALL_REGISTRATION

Any other request, not listed among the previous request topics is considered unknown, and the method will return xMsgContants.ERROR

Parameters:registration_request (bytes[]) – Multipart message received by the xMsgRegService thread.
Returns:response to the received registration request
Return type:xMsgResponse
run()[source]¶

xMsgRegService thread method to process registration requests

During its execution will receive the registration request and will process the petition, sending a response.

Method description:

while thread is alive:
    reg_service_response = process_request(registration_request)
    send_back(reg_service_response)

xmsg.xsys.regdis.xMsgRegUpdater module¶

class xmsg.xsys.regdis.xMsgRegUpdater.xMsgRegUpdater(driver, publishers_db, subscribers_db)[source]¶

Bases: threading.Thread

This is a thread that periodically updates xMsg front-end registration database with passed publishers and subscribers database contents. These passed databases (i.e. references) are xMsgNode resident databases, defined within the xMsgRegistrar class. This class will be instantiated by the xMsgRegistrar constructor executed by the xMsgNode:

This class inherits from xMsgRegDrive where xMsg database communication methods are defined.

driver¶

xMsgRegDriver – registration driver

publishers_db¶

xMsgRegDatabase – publishers database

subscribers_db¶

xMsgRegDatabase – subscribers database

name¶

String – name of updater instance

run()[source]¶

xMsgRegUpdater thread method to update the frontend registration db

Every cicle will try to push the registration information into the frontend registration database. The defined algorithm for this task is described below.

Method description:

while thread is alive:
    for each topic in subscribers_database:
        register_in_fe(topic)

    sleep .5 seconds

    for each topic in subscribers_database:
        register_in_fe(topic)

    sleep .5 seconds
